thag6.5:5.2: craving grows in them like a parasitic creeper.
thag6.5:5.3: They jump from life to life, like a monkey
thag6.5:5.4: greedy for fruit in a forest grove.
thag6.5:6.1: Whoever is beaten by this wretched craving,
thag6.5:7.1: But whoever prevails over this wretched craving,
thag6.5:7.2: so hard to get over in the world,
thag6.5:7.4: like a drop from a lotus-leaf.
thag6.5:8.1: I say this to you, good people,
thag6.5:8.2: all those who have gathered here:
thag6.5:8.3: dig up the root of craving,
thag6.5:8.4: as you’d dig up the grass in search of roots.
thag6.5:8.5: Don’t let Māra break you again and again,
thag6.5:8.6: like a stream breaking a reed.
thag6.5:9.2: don’t let the moment pass you by.
thag6.5:9.3: For if you miss your moment
thag6.5:9.4: you’ll grieve when you’re sent to hell.
thag6.5:10.2: negligence is included as a toxin.
thag6.5:10.4: pluck out the dart from yourself.
